listing.listing_description: This stunning contemporary chalet at Whistler Mountain is located just thirty meters from Village Run above Skier's Plaza, leading directly to both Excalibur Gondola and Whistler Village Gondola (each about 330 meters away). Featuring spacious and exquisite interior living areas, a deluxe terrace with alfresco hot tub, and four superb bedroom suites sleeping ten, Whistler Slopeside is an ideal vacation rental for families and groups of friends seeking serene privacy and extraordinary convenience in the heart of British Colombia's finest alpine resort.The villa's luminous great room offers a fresh interpretation of the classic alpine lodge, with high, vaulted ceilings of exposed wood and expansive windows gazing out on Whistler vistas. Returning from an adventurous day on the slopes, kindle a fire in the wood-burning fireplace and savor a fine wine in the comfortable lounge. Sip hot cocoa on the alfresco terrace, fire up the grill for a hearty barbeque, and soothe your body in the hot tub while breathing the delicious air. Prepare hearty meals in the gourmet kitchen, fully equipped with chef-grade appliances and ample countertops, and gather around the beautiful dining table for ten. The villa's décor is exquisite throughout, with superb contemporary artwork adding unique style to the traditional chalet ambiance. Heating, smart TVs, and an office space help ensure total comfort and convenience during your stay.The outstanding master bedroom suite features a king bed, vaulted wood ceilings, a private balcony, and an ensuite bathroom with dual vanity and rain shower. Two of the guestrooms have one queen bed each, while the third bedroom has two bunk beds, perfect for kids. Beautifully furnished, the bedrooms offer perfectly cozy spaces for afternoon downtime and tranquil nights before your next adventure.The villa enjoys one of the finest locations at Whistler. You're literally steps from the Village Run ski and bike trail, which takes you directly down to the two gondolas. The heart of Whistler Village, with its outstanding dining and nightlife, is less than two kilometers away. Mountain bikers are just a few minutes from Whistler Mountain Bike Park, and golfers a short ride to both Whistler Golf Club and Fairmount Chateau Whistler Golf Club.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: This beautiful chalet in Mont-Tremblant Station is situated in the serene enclave of Le Grande Foret. With gorgeous indoor and outdoor living areas, and a unique, exquisite design that joins classic alpine charm with a contemporary aesthetic, Chalet Trappeur is the ideal vacation rental for families and groups of friends seeking luxurious privacy at the foot of Quebec's finest mountain.The chalet's open-plan Great Room and lovely deck create a superb setting for bright mornings and cozy evenings. Returning from the ski slopes or hiking trails, dip your body in the outdoor hot tub, sip warm drinks by the alfresco fireplace, and light up grill for barbeque cooking in the crisp, Laurentian air. Withdrawing indoors for the night, relax around the stone hearth with fireplace and flat-screen television, enjoying cocktails on the sofa or at the island bar, as the chefs among you prepare delicious meals in the fully equipped kitchen. Then gather at the elegant, ten-person dining table for a hearty feast. At night, repair to the media lounge to relax on its sumptuous sectional and watch your favorite movies. The chalet's décor—combining luminous, white walls with pickled wood ceilings and exposed beams—offers a fresh and contemporary variation on the classic Quebecois chalet.The chalet's serene and lovely bedrooms provide perfect sanctuaries for private downtime and peaceful nights. The master bedroom features a king bed, furnished balcony, and ensuite bathroom with stand-alone shower and tub. The two primary guest rooms both have queen beds and share a Jack & Jill bathroom. The fourth bedroom, perfect for kids, has two charming bunk beds. All of the bedrooms are beautifully furnished and decorated.Chalet Trappeur strikes a lovely balance of seclusion and convenience, allowing you to enjoy Mont-Tremblant while relishing the privacy of home. With snowshoeing right out your door, you're also just a short drive to the slopes via Cabriolet Gondola. The golf courses of Le Geant and Le Diable are also within minutes by car. Tremblant Village is about twelve kilometers away, and the precious nature preserve of Mont-Tremblant National Park is an easy drive from your door.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Get close to the mountain in contemporary luxury at Havre des Legendes 113. Just steps from the Nansen Bas ski run and a short drive from Tremblant Village and more, this Mont-Tremblant Station vacation rental puts you at the heart of the area’s ski scene. Four bedrooms and beautifully appointed living areas can welcome groups of up to eleven friends or extended family on holiday together.In warmer weather, enjoy the scenery from outdoor living areas with a hot tub, barbecue and dining area; in cooler weather, get cozy with the help of a gas fireplace, ping-pong and pool tables, a cable television, Sonos sound system, Wi-Fi and a wine fridge. Laundry facilities mean you’ll always start the day with fresh gear, and both air conditioning and heated floors mean you’ll stay comfortable no matter what the temperature outside.The villa is laid out around a striking open-concept great room with a double-height ceiling over the living area, a dining area with seating for ten and a fully equipped kitchen with a breakfast bar. A huge window floods the space with light, and mid-century-inspired furnishings add sleek style.Havre des Legendes 113 has one bedroom with a king bed and two bedrooms with queen beds that have private en-suite bathrooms. The fourth bedroom has a king bed and shares a hall bathroom with a den that has three additional twin beds and two trundle beds.Your stay at Havre des Legendes includes complimentary shuttle service from a stop just 100 meters from the villa. It’s an equally short walk to the Nansen Bas ski run and a short drive to the Express Flying Mile chairlift. Also within easy reach are several golf courses, the Mont Tremblant Casino and downtown Tremblant Village, where you can stop for a quick bite at a café or sit down to a multi-course, honeymoon-worthy dinner.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Set in the heart of the storied Laurentides skiing region, this villa occupies an excellent position near the town of Mont Tremblant. Recognised as Canada’s best known ski-town, guests will instantly settle in the cosy, pine-rich interior, with vaulted ceiling and cosy fireplace, plus sauna and pool. These features ensure the villa’s year-round appeal, with the town’s famous night-life close by.Altitude 172-10 is a fantastic choice for those looking to savor the fresh snow in one of the very finest ski resorts in North America. Just over an hour’s drive north from Montreal, guests will be immersed in the mountain atmosphere and fun-time energy of a happening ski community, located just 3 minutes walk from the chalet’s door. The property’s fine outfitting, apt and atmospheric use of pine furnishings, fully-equipped entertainment system and welcoming bedrooms ensures that groups can relax in style. The four seasons barbecue and huge kitchen will make mealtime a pleasure, no matter the time of year.Once guests have settled into this villa, the options for outings and day activities will soon become apparent. A short walk from the property will bring guests to the heart of Mont Tremblant, where ski-lifts provide direct access to some of Canada’s finest slopes. The shopping, dining and bar options of the town itself are without compare in Quebec, with microbreweries and Canadian-focussed fine dining being available year-round. Beyond the resort, tranquil lakes, picturesque valley towns and seasonal sugar shacks of the region help make for great excursion options. Guests can explore both the local resort and broader region before returning to the warm lights and cosy interior of the chalet for a glass of mulled wine, as the fireplace creates an aura of comfort after a packed day’s action.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Enjoy both mountain views and a location just steps from the nearest ski run at Havre des Legendes 111. This corner-unit vacation rental in an exclusive Mont-Tremblant Station community puts you 100 meters from both the Nansen Bas ski trail and the complimentary shuttle stop, so you can spend more time out in the mountains. Eight bedrooms and stunning contemporary architecture can accommodate groups of up to sixteen friends or extended family in modern luxury.Havre des Legendes 111 boasts outdoor living areas with a covered terrace, hot tub, barbecue and al-fresco dining for eight where you can take a brief honeymoon from your worries. If it’s too chilly outside, cozy up inside by the wood-burning fireplace, ping-pong and pool tables, cable television, Sonos sound system, Wi-Fi and wine fridge.You’ll want to spend most of your holiday in the villa’s open-concept great room, which features an airy living area with a double-height ceiling, a dining area with seating for twelve and a fully equipped kitchen with a breakfast bar. Shades of gray and streamlined furnishings give the space urban-inspired appeal, while wood beams and floors lend more rustic touches.The villa has three bedrooms with king beds and private en-suite bathrooms. There are also three bedrooms with queen beds and two bedrooms with two twin beds and a trundle bed each, all of which have access to shared hall bathrooms.Start each day by making the short walk to the nearest ski run or the shuttle stop, or the short drive to the Express Flying Mile chairlift. In the evenings, make your way to the excitement of Mont Tremblant Casino or the shops and restaurants of Tremblant Village. If you’ll be visiting during warmer weather, the villa is close to several golf courses and the stunning scenery of Mont Tremblant National Park.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Take a ski vacation that will become part of family lore at Havre des Legends 102. Spacious and stylish, this modern Mont Tremblant residence was designed to balance contemporary luxury with the natural beauty of its surroundings. Plus, its ski-in, ski-out location means you’ll spend that much more time on the slopes.After a day on the hill, cozy up to the wood-burning fireplace, put a favorite album on the sound system, share photos of your holiday via Wi-Fi or stir up a friendly competition around the pool table. If you want to indulge, pour a glass from the wine fridge and soak under the stars in the al-fresco hot tub. For guests visiting during warmer weather, the villa has a private deck with a barbecue and outdoor dining for eight.Vaulted ceilings, shiplap paneling, and exposed wooden beams put the villa’s interiors right on trend, while an open-plan layout gives everyone a place to gather. Nearly floor-to-ceiling windows and a double-height stone fireplace emphasize the great room’s airy dimensions, and mid-century-inspired furnishings up the style quotient of the living and dining areas. In the fully equipped kitchen, you’ll find a convenient breakfast bar and an intriguing mix of materials.This vacation rental has two bedrooms with king beds: one with an en-suite bathroom and one with a shared bathroom. The other two bedrooms have a queen bed and a double bed plus twin trundle, respectively, and share a bathroom. Vintage ski posters and paintings are a fun touch in the bedrooms and bathrooms.From Havre des Legends 102, it’s a short walk (or ski) to the Nansen Bas ski run, and a short drive to both the Express Flying Mile chairlift and the Cabriolet gondola. The villa’s Mont Tremblant Station setting is also close enough to the casino and village that you can stop in to try your luck, browse the boutiques or sit down to a honeymoon-worthy dinner. If you’ll be taking a summer trip rather than a ski break, plan to tee off at two nearby golf courses.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Grand Foret Villa is a luxurious five bedroom home located in one of Mont-Tremblant’s most peaceful environments. In addition to a great view of the ski hill, Grand Foret Villa has its own hiking trail and boardwalk through the forest. Enjoy the nature surrounding this bijou villa and allow Mont-Tremblant to sweep you away with its luxurious mountain charm.Relax and play music on your integrated sound system. With lighting that can be controlled from central panels, you have all your desires just a button away. Relax with a glass of wine or cocktail from the wet bar as you warm up near the magnificent glass fireplace. Play a game of billiards in the game room or enjoy your television and Wi-Fi. Children and adults alike will love the brand new tree house/garden studio! Perched up high and equipped with a slide and swings, this area transforms into a tubing course in the winter! Or perhaps a soothing soak in the outdoor hot tub?Stunning architecture, modern amenities, and an open space concept make Grand Foret Villa the perfect house for families, friends or business gatherings. The kitchen features rich wood and a smooth breakfast bar with five stools. With a dining area for eight surrounded by windows, you’ll feel at one with the mountain environment as you enjoy a delicious meal.A total of five bedrooms can accommodate up to fourteen guests at Grand Foret Villa. Enjoy the two master bedrooms including en-suite bathroom, walk-in closet and television. Grand wood outlined windows in each bedroom allow you to wake up to the forest’s beauty every morning. With two captain’s bunk beds in one of the bedrooms, it’s perfect for families.Lac Mercier is a small lake providing the shoreline for Old Mont-Tremblant Village. A paved pathway on the east side of Lac Mercier offers a lovely way to experience the natural beauty of the lake. If you enjoy exploring the wilderness, the Mont-Tremblant National Park provides a wide variety of trails from gentle walks to vigorous hikes. Winter in the Laurentians provides even more opportunity for exploration including snowshoeing or cross-country skiing. Mont Tremblant Ski Resort provides a challenge for all levels of skiing or snowboarding, and the picturesque pedestrian village is a great place to experience some lively Quebec après-ski.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Enjoy modern luxury amid centuries-old landscapes at Ancient Cedars. This Whistler vacation rental may sit among the timeless forests and mountains of B.C., but its contemporary architecture and thoughtful amenities are decidedly of the moment. Its style is matched by an incredible setting in the exclusive Kadenwood neighborhood that offers ski-in, ski-out access to the slopes.Look out over Whistler and the surrounding Tantalus Range from a heated patio that can be enjoyed year-round. The outdoor areas also feature a heated pool, hot tub and barbecue; inside, there’s a wet bar, wine cellar, ping-pong and foosball tables, cable TV, a Sonos sound system and Wi-Fi. Flip on the heated floors or fireplace to stay cozy, and let the elevator whisk you from one floor to the next.A great room framed in wood and glass is the perfect spot to gather with friends and family to reconnect, dine and watch the sunset over the mountains. The open-concept space has two sitting areas—one with a fireplace and one with a TV—and a dining table for ten, plus a fully equipped kitchen with state-of-the-art appliances.Ancient Cedars has three bedrooms with king beds, including one master bedroom with a honeymoon-suite-inspired lounge area and private terrace. There are also two bedrooms with queen beds and two bedrooms with two twin beds each. All seven bedrooms have en-suite bathrooms.If you’ve come for a ski holiday, you’ll appreciate being able to ski out the front door to the private Kadenwood gondola, less than a quarter-mile away. For shopping, dining and your apres-ski needs, it’s about a 10-minute drive to Creekside Village and the main Whistler Village. If you’re visiting during the summer, you’ll find two golf courses nearby, plus beautiful Blueberry Beach on scenic Alta Lake.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Grab your gear from the locker room, step outside, and ski down a private run to Kadenwood Gondola at this mountain-view lodge in Whistler. When you’re done for the day, ski right back, throw your boots on the warmer, and hop into the hot tub, unless the sauna is more of your style. Once your batteries are recharged, drive into Whistler Village for some craft beers at Coast Mountain Brewing.On nights in, stay warm by the fireplace while you gaze through floor-to-ceiling windows framing soaring views of the mountains. Create an unforgettable meal in the chef’s kitchen or out on the barbecue. After dinner, have the entertainer in your group play a little piano while you whip up a few cocktails at the wet bar. In the morning, have an Espresso, head out, and housekeeping will take care of the aftermath.In the warmer months, enjoy the from the balcony, dine alfresco, and work on your game on the putting green. If you’re not abandoning your fitness routine while on vacation, Trails End has a state of the art home gym with plenty of equipment and TVs. After a workout, sink into the plush sofa in the family room and watch a movie with the kids.From the private ski-run outside, you’ll have quick and easy ski-in/ski-out access to the Kadenwood gondola. Whistler Village, Excalibur, and Wizard Express ski lifts are all within 11 kilometers as well. In the summer, Blueberry Beach at Lake Alta is the perfect place for family swimming. And, if there’s a golf aficionado in the group, Fairmont Chateau’s course is incredibly scenic and challenging.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Convenience and natural beauty characterize this fine hillside chalet. Located close to the Whistler Blackcomb ski resort, the plush upper landing of the cozy, excellently-outfitted home provides a captivating forest landscape view. Wooden pillars, carved flagstone floors and peaceful, high-ceilinged bedrooms add character to the home, with ski slopes, lake beaches, fine dining and hiking nearby.The towering, viewpoint windows of this home’s living room provide a sense of isolated splendour, with the landscape sweeping down and away from the home. Inside, a grand wrought-iron chandelier hangs over the lengthy dining table, contrasting nicely with the rich wooden hues that infuse each room. Ample space combines with a clean, minimal decor choice to help make sure the impact of the panorama visible outside is not diluted or obscured. Pleasant interior features ensure guests will be perfectly comfortable in summer or winter, with a cozy gas fireplace and always-popular foosball table helping to realize great group stays.Peak Chalet offers unparalleled access to the ski runs of Whistler, which offer slope quality and variety that has made this resort famous across Western Canada. Take in the beauty of the valley from the peak-to-peak cable car, or make the short walk to the scenic beach at Alta Lake. Guests can engage in everything from mountain-biking, to local kayaking, to cross-country snow machining and skiing, while the local town itself offers warm hospitality in the form of varied restaurants, bars and craft brewing. Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Between the ski slopes and the lake you’ll find The Lodge Mont-Tremblant, a magical retreat hidden in the forest. In the winter, enjoy easy access to ski lifts; in the summer, take advantage of the nearby golf courses. Resort-worthy outdoor areas, 10,000 square feet of living space and six bedrooms make this vacation rental perfect for groups of up to twelve friends or family members.If you’ll be visiting during the summer, savor the mild temperatures and long evenings from the pool and a lavish pool house with living and dining areas. There are also two gas barbecues and a firepit. If you’ll be chasing thrills on the ski slopes, leave gear in a dedicated storage room with boot heaters, treat yourself to a session in the sauna, stretch out in the exercise room or unwind by the pool table, wood-burning fireplaces and television.Perched on a rock face amid a pine forest, the timber walls of The Lodge Mont-Tremblant have undeniable rustic charm. It continues inside, where the open-concept living and dining areas are laid out under high ceilings or tucked next to stately fireplaces. There’s plenty of room for everyone to gather around a dining table that seats eight, and a butler’s pantry and two breakfast bars make using the fully equipped kitchen a pleasure.There are four bedrooms in the lodge’s main house and two in its guest quarters; all six have the luxury of en-suite bathrooms. In the main house, there are two master suites—one with a king bed and private jetted tub, and one with a queen bed—as well as a kids’ room with two double beds and an additional bedroom with two twin beds. The two guest bedrooms have a queen bed and two twin beds, respectively.Thanks to the lodge’s setting in the Mont-Tremblant Station area, you’re just a short drive from the base of the ski resort in season and from Le Géant and Le Diable golf courses when it’s warmer out. To find the perfect souvenir of your holiday or enjoy a honeymoon-style dinner out, turn to the shops and restaurants of nearby Tremblant Village.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Ski out to Telecabine Express Lift each morning from this trendy condo overlooking the lake and resort of Mont-Tremblant. After a day on the slopes, rest by the wood-burning fireplace after you warm up in the semi-private sauna or hot tub. Once your batteries are recharged, drive 10-minutes to Mont Tremblant Village for dinner at Choux Gras Brasserie Culinaire and drinks after at Gypsy.Modern architecture meets traditional ski lodge at this chic condo. With sweeping views across the dining area and living room lounge, you’ll feel the imposing presence of the mountains everywhere you go. Peaked ceilings and warm wood floors are a throwback to simpler times, while the fully-equipped kitchen, Apple TV, and spa-like ensuite add an elegant, modern touch.Altitude comes with 2 indoor parking spots, ski storage, and ski-in/ski-out access to Mont Tremblant. Firewood is included during your stay, as well as access to the shared hot tub and sauna. If you’re dining in, the condo’s formal setting seats 8, and there are 5 stools beside at the kitchen’s breakfast bar. On your way home, pick up something fresh to grill on the balcony’s barbeque.If you’re vacationing in the warmer months, golfing at Le Geant and Le Diablo are great ways to get out and embrace Tremblant’s rugged mountain landscapes. Cycling, hiking, and rock climbing are other popular activities in the area. Any time of year, Mont Tremblant Village is buzzing with excitement. Spend a day exploring the newest gear in boutique ski shops or test out your luck at the casino.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: As inviting as a chalet and as stylish as any contemporary home, Huntingford Lodge redefines the modern ski retreat. Not only was this stunning Whistler vacation rental designed to maximize views of the Tantalus Mountains, but its location in the exclusive Kadenwood community puts you just steps from the nearest run and a short walk from a private gondola.You'll be welcomed to Huntingford Lodge by a villa host and pampered during your holiday by amenities from media and exercise rooms to a mini-spa with a sauna and steam room, ping-pong and pool tables, a wet bar, a Sonos sound system and Wi-Fi. A soak in the al-fresco hot tub is the perfect antidote to a long day on the slopes; if you're staying over the summer you can enjoy the mountain views from around the barbecue on the deck or the firepit.Floor-to-ceiling glass and an open-concept layout mean there are views for miles even from inside the lodge. A wood-burning fireplace forms the focal point of a welcoming sitting area, state-of-the-art appliances stock the fully equipped chef's kitchen, and there's seating for up to twelve family and friends in sculptural chairs around the polished dining table.Each of the five bedrooms at this luxury property has an en-suite bathroom. There are four with king beds, including two master suites, and one bunk room that kids will love for its two twin-over-double bunk beds.Huntingford Lodge is a short walk-and an even shorter ski-from the nearest run, and only 10 minutes by foot from the Kadenwood gondola. It's also a short drive from the Excalibur gondola at Whistler, the shops and eateries of Whistler Village, and the Fairmont Chateau Whistler, where you can indulge in a spa treatment, sit down to a honeymoon-worthy dinner or, in warmer weather, challenge yourself to a round of golf.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Take your ski holiday to the pinnacle at High Point. A contemporary take on the mountain chalet, this stunning seven-bedroom vacation rental is a unique luxury offering on the slopes of Whistler. Its location just one minute from the private Kadenwood gondola means you'll spend that much more time on each day's runs.High Point has all the amenities of a ski resort and more, from exercise, media and steam rooms to Apple TV, a sound system and Wi-Fi. Watch the stars come out over the snow-capped hills while cozied up to the outdoor fireplace and heat lamps or soaking in the al-fresco hot tub. For the hardiest souls (or summer visitors), there's a barbecue on the deck as well.Exposed timbers, vaulted ceilings and a stone fireplace nod to traditional chalet style as they form the outline of the villa's expansive great room, while sleek furnishings lend a refined modern look. Gather around the wood-burning hearth on the sectional, seat twelve friends or family at the table for dinner and serve up well-deserved après-ski snacks from a fully equipped kitchen with beautifully paneled cabinets.High Point has three bedrooms with en-suite bathrooms: a honeymoon-worthy master suite with a king bed and its own fireplace and balcony, a second bedroom with a king bed and one bedroom with a queen bed. There are also two pairs of bedrooms that share a bathroom: one with a queen bed and two twin beds in the respective bedrooms, and one with a twin bed plus a loft bed in each bedroom.Find ski-in, ski-out convenience along with style at this property, which is just steps from the nearest run and a 1-minute walk from the Kadenwood gondola. A short drive will bring you to Creekside Village and its gondola, Whistler Village and its gondola, or the Excalibur gondola. If you'll be visiting in warmer weather, the villa is also close to golf, mountain biking trails and beautiful Blueberry Beach on Alta Lake.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.
